database

Class DBconnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.DBconnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DBconnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Class for wrapping and simplifying a jdbc database connection
    Author:
    Florian

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBconnection

        public DBconnection(java.lang.String connectionString,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        standard constructor, tries establish a connection to the server automatically
        Parameters:
        connectionString - A string formed like "jdbc:[IPadress]:[port]/[Schema]
        username - login name for DB server
        password - login password for the specified user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database failed connecting to the server

    • Method Detail

      • refreshConnection

        private void refreshConnection()
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connection refresh, called automatically
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the refresh failed

      • createStatement

        public java.sql.PreparedStatement createStatement(java.lang.String sql)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a PreparedStatement that is secure against SQL insertions if used correctly
        Parameters:
        sql - SQL query String. Can also contain '?' Characters that can be replaced.
        Returns:
        a statement that can be executed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the statement contains errors or the S´server connection failed

      • request

        public java.sql.ResultSet request(java.sql.PreparedStatement stat)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        executes a PreparedStatements on this DB as a query
        Parameters:
        stat - the statement that has to be executed
        Returns:
        ResultSet with the query result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the statement could not be executed

      • execute

        public int execute(java.sql.PreparedStatement stat)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        executes a statement as a non-query instruction such are insertions, deletions, updates and count instructions
        Parameters:
        stat - the PreparedStatement having the SQL instruction
        Returns:
        int containing the result, 0, or a negative number
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if execution fails

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the DB connection
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection is already closed
